Come ſet my ſoul at liberty,
that I may hear thy voice.

sp.speaker: Chr.
sp.l: Soul I am nigh, to hear thy cry,
Pſal. 34.15. verſ. 17. Pſal. 145.19ſupply to thee ſhall come,
I'le ſet the free from miſery,
for thee I will then own.

sp.speaker: Sin.
sp.l: Unworthy, Lord I am indeed,
of ſuch choice favour to
Injoy from thee, Oh! let me ſee,
what for me thou wilt do.

lg.l: I will preſent, thy great complaint,
Heb. 7.25. Jer. 31.34. Jer. 32.40.unto my Father dear,
And thou ſhalt ſee, that he will be
thy God; Oh! do not fear.
Rom. 6.6. Exo. 33.19. Exod. 34.6. 2 Cor. 3.18.Thy ſin ſhall die, he'l Magnifie,
his Rich, his choice free Grace,
In ſetting thee at Liberty,
and thou ſhalt ſee his Face.

sp.speaker: Sin.
sp.l: Oh! pretious Lord, do thou afford,
to me thy Grace moſt ſweet;
Come cleanſe my heart, to me impart,
a change I do intreat.

lg.l: I'le cleanſe thy heart, I will impart, Deut. 30.6. Luk. 11.13. Jer. 31.3. Phil. 2.13. Pſal. 110.3. Luke 1.79. Pſal. 16.11. Jer. 50.20.
my Spirit thou ſhalt find,
I will thee give, a cleanſed heart,
and to thee i'le be kind.
I'le change thy will, I will be ſtill,
thy God and eke thy guide;
In my ſweet preſence thou ſhalt dwell,
and thy great ſins i'le hide.

div.head: A Pretious Conference BETWEEN CHRIST and a CHRISTIAN.

sp.speaker: Chriſt,
sp.l: COme take thy fill of Love moſt choice,
and Conſolation high, Cant. 5.1. Rev. 2.29. Cant. 1.13.
And give attention to my Voice,
and in my boſom lie.

sp.speaker: Chriſtian,
sp.l: True Lord, thy love it is moſt rare,
Communion I would have,
Oh! give it down, and do not ſpare,
thy boſom loves I crave.

sp.speaker: Chriſt,
sp.l: When thou an out-caſt wert indeed, Ezek. 16.5. Prov. 9.2. Cant. 2.4.
I then did take thee in,
And at my Table made thee feed,
on dainties choice, and ſing.

sp.speaker: Chriſtian,
sp.l: Yea, Lord when unlovely I was,
yet lovely in thy ſight,
I in my Blood, thou ſeeſt it good,
to manifeſt thy Light.

sp.speaker: Chriſt,
sp.l: Ezek. 16.4. John 14.16. John 15.10.My Skirt of Love, I ſpred on thee,
thy nakedneſs to hide,
That my ſweet prenſence thou might'ſt ſee,
and with me might'ſt abide.

sp.speaker: Chriſtian,
sp.l: Thy eye of pitty to me was,
made known at a high rate,
In waſhing me from filth that day,
and life thou did'ſt create.

sp.speaker: Chriſt,
sp.l: When I paſt by, and ſaw the lie,
Eze. 16.6, 7polluted in thy blood,
In love to thee, I did draw nigh,
and holp thee for thy good.

sp.speaker: Chriſtian,
sp.l: Oh! praiſed be thy great high Name,
for what thou didſt for me,
Thy tender Love I muſt proclaim,
and what of thee I ſee.

sp.speaker: Chriſt,
sp.l: A converſation choice and ſweet,
Phil. 1.27. Amos 4.12.will honour me indeed;
Oh! then I will thy poor Soul meet,
on Manna thou ſhalt feed.

sp.speaker: Chriſtian,
sp.l: Oh! help me Lord, to live to thee,
a Godly Holy Life,
And in Communion let me be,
indeed thy married Wife.

sp.speaker: Chriſt,
sp.l: Iſa. 54.5. John 6.37. Cant. 7.10.A Husband then i'le be to thee,
for none I will caſt out,
That doth in truth now come to me,
thine I am without doubt.

sp.speaker: Chriſtian,
sp.l: How ſhall I know, Lord thou art mine,
and I am one with thee,
The perfect Union let me find,
and now united be?

sp.speaker: Chriſt,
sp.l: Iſa. 43.1. Jer. 31.33. Jer. 31.3.I know thy name, Oh! thou art mine,
in Covenant we be,
My love indeed ſhall not decline,
more of it thou ſhalt ſee.

sp.speaker: Chriſtian,
sp.l: Of Covenants two, Lord we do read,
In thy moſt Bleſſed Word;
Which of them Lord, haſt thou now made
to me, O Bleſſed God.

sp.speaker: Chriſt,
sp.l: My Covenant that I have made, Jer. 31.31. Heb. 8.10. Jer. 31.32.
is new and choice alſo,
Not like to that, of Iſrael's ſaid,
they brake, yea, long agoe.

sp.speaker: Chriſtian,
sp.l: What difference pray may there be,
between the Old and New,
The difference Lord, Oh! let me ſee,
let's know what we muſt do?

sp.speaker: Chriſt,
sp.l:
The Old it comes from Mount Sina,
Gal. 4.24. Mich. 4.2. Gal. 4.26.
a Covenant of Works;
The New it comes from Mount Zion,
a Covenant of Grace.

sp.speaker: Chriſtian,
sp.l: Doth God require no works of me,
that by them I may live,
That by my works may Heaven ſee,
Or for my works he'l ſave?

sp.speaker: Chriſt,
sp.l: No works at all do I require, Epheſ. 2.9. Tit. 3.5. Rom. 5.1. 1 John 1.7.
nor can they produce Life,
But Faith in me doth God require,
it's I muſt end the ſtrife.

sp.speaker: Chriſtian,
sp.l: The terms of thy ſweet Covenant,
dear Lord, What may they be?
Let's underſtand, Oh! out of hand,
come let us know of thee.

lg.l: The Covenant of Grace, it is
conditions on my part, Jer. 31.33. Heb. 8.10.
Wherein I am ingag'd to thee,
to write upon thy Heart
My Royal Law of Grace indeed,
and be to thee a God; Pſal. 32.8. Luke 1.97.
Thou unto me a People be,
i'le alſo be thy guide.
As for thy ſins and tranſgreſſions,
no more will I remember,
Jer. 33.34. Iſa. 43.25.But will make known to thee, I own
a blotting out for ever.

sp.speaker: Chriſtian,
sp.l: My Love, my Lord, my King, my Choice
thy path let me behold,
And daily hear thy lovely voice,
thy love to me unfold.

lg.l: Cant. 2.4.Into my banquetting-houſe come
and take thy fill, my Love,
Cant. 4.8.Of Flagons ſweet, I will thee meet,
and there embrace my Dove.
Cant. 2.6.The banner of my love diſplay
I will on thee indeed,
Cant. 2.5.And quickly come, I'l not delay,
on apples thou ſhalt feed.
My Love, my Dove, my Joy, my Crown,
oh come, oh come away:
The Foxes ſpoil, thy Church renown,
make haſt and do not ſtay.
Rev. 21.2.My Bride I come, with motions ſwift,
my Vineyard to maintain,
Cant. 2.15. Pſal. 2.6.The Fox I'l ſlay, my crowning day
my Kingdom I ſhall gain.

sp.speaker: Chriſtian,
sp.l: Oh Bridegroom dear, when thou appear,
my robes do thou put on,
And cauſe my Lamp to burn moſt clear
and with thee make me one.

lg.l: 1 Joh. 2.20.My Bride the unction thou ſhalt have,
that will thy Lamp here trim,
Mat. 25.4. Joel 2.28.And cauſe thy Light to ſhine moſt bright,
this oyl I will put in.
Mat. 25.10The door againſt thee ſhall not ſhut,
but entrance thou ſhalt have,
Mat. 25.12 Mat. 25.8.When other Virgins be kept out,
for oyl they then will crave.
When they for oyl ſhall make a-do
Mat. 25.thy Bridegroom then will come,
And in the kingdom thou ſhalt be,
when oyl they ſhall find none.

sp.speaker: Chriſtian,
sp.l: Dear Lord, oh hear the cries and groans
that the oppreſſed make,
And hearken to the daily moans,
their bonds, oh do thou break. Pſal. 23.4.

lg.l: My preſent rod ſhall prove for good,
to humble them thereby, Deut. 8.16.
Then privy ſearch, I'l make for blood, Rev. 6.10.
and all my foes ſhall dy. Iſa. 10.10.
The work on mount Sion muſt be
before that I will come,
Then will I break Aſſyrians heart,
and ruine Babylon.

sp.speaker: Chriſtian,
sp.l: Come Lord and purge thine own people,
by thy refining fire,
Let affliction refine us clean,
as thou doſt now deſire.

sp.speaker: Chriſt,
sp.l: That is my end in what I do,
in love I do chaſtiſe, Rev. 3.19. Micah 6.8. Iſa. 48.18.
That better fruit you may bring out,
and learn for to be wiſe.

sp.speaker: Chriſtian,
sp.l: Thy wiſdom Lord, oh from above
let me enjoy, I pray;
Then love I ſhall the Turtle Dove,
and him obey this day.

sp.speaker: Chriſt,
sp.l: My wiſdom pure and peaceable, Jam. 3.17.
thou ſhalt poſſeſs indeed,
That teaches thee, gentle to be, Jam. 3.17.
and on it thou ſhalt feed.

sp.speaker: Chriſtian,
sp.l: How long thy abſence ſhall I ſee?
thy preſence I deſire,
Oh when in Canaan ſhall we be,
and walk with thee entire?

sp.speaker: Chriſt,
sp.l: My Love the glorious land is near,2 Sam. 22.19. Iſa. 52.9, 10
my preſence thou ſhalt ſee,
And in my boſom thou ſhalt ly;
there thee and I will be.

sp.speaker: Chriſtian,
sp.l: It is my grief and ſorrow great,
that a ſtranger I be,
That I indeed cannot relate
what I would have of thee.

sp.speaker: Chriſt,
sp.l: Rev. 22.1, 2 Pſal. 36.8. Pſal. 46.4.Thy wants I know, ſupply ſhall come
yea from the living tree,
The Rivers of my love ſhall run,
and comfort thou ſhalt ſee.

sp.speaker: Chriſtian,
sp.l: When thou doſt ſpeak, I do forget,
thy meſſage choice and ſweet,
Therefore to me afford ſome help,
oh Lord, I do intreat.

sp.speaker: Chriſt,
sp.l: John 14.26. Luk. 1.78, 79. Luk. 1.75. I am at hand poor ſoul indeed,
thee memory I will give,
Yea by the hand I will thee lead,
as long as thou doſt live.

sp.speaker: Chriſtian,
sp.l: My burthen Lord is very great,
that earthly things I mind,
Oh help me Lord I do intreat,
thy preſence let me find.

sp.speaker: Christ,
sp.l: Col. 3.3. Pſal. 94.19. Pſal. 27.4. Iſa. 35. last. On things above, oh thou my love,
delight thou ſhalt therein.
And live with me, yea day by day,
and Hallelujah ſing.

sp.speaker: Chriſtian,
sp.l: Dear Lord ariſe, and manifeſt
thy power and thy might,
Pull Babel down, and wear the Crown,
put Babylon to flight.

sp.speaker: Chriſt,
sp.l: Rev. 3.11. Rev. 18.4. Rev. 14.1.My day is near, oh do not fear,
for Babel that ſhall down,
And gloriouſly I will appear,
in glory and renown.

sp.speaker: Chriſtian,
sp.l: When Lord ſhall I behold the day
that Zion ſhall rejoyce,
And Judah then the Scepter ſway?
come let us hear thy voice.

sp.speaker: Chriſt,
sp.l: Iſa. 32.1. Jer. 31.7. Iſa. 51.1.Behold the day is very nigh,
my kingdom I muſt have,
Zion ſhall ſing and eke rejoyce,
the Captives I will ſave.

sp.speaker: Chriſtian,
sp.l: Come Jeſus come, come quickly Lord,
we long to ſee thy Face,
Oh! do not ſtay, we do the pray,
and furniſh us with Grace.

sp.speaker: Christ,
sp.l: My Grace to you I will afford, Pſal. 84.11. 2 Cor. 1.3. Cant. 1.13.
and comforts of all kind,
For you with me ſhall bed and board,
and know more of my mind.

sp.speaker: Chriſtian,
sp.l: Oh! take me up in raviſhment,
and let me take my fill;
That die I may, to earth this day,
and witneſs Heavenly skil.

sp.speaker: Chriſt,
sp.l: Soul take thy fill abundantly, Cant. 5.1. Iſa. 40.11. Hab. 3.18.
on Heaven feed then more,
And in my Father's Boſom lie,
and joy in him therefore.

sp.speaker: Chriſtian,
sp.l: To Heaven Lord, how ſhall I get?
there do I long to be,
That with my Father I may ſit,
the Earth no more may ſee.

sp.speaker: Chriſt,
sp.l: I am the way, by which you may,
obtain to your deſire, John 14.6. Pſal. 37.4. 1 Cor. 3.13.
And if to Heaven you go this day,
you muſt paſs through the fire.

sp.speaker: Chriſtian,
sp.l: That would I do, rather than loſe
my Fellowſhip indeed,
With Father, Son, and Angels choice,
and Manna Angels food.

lg.l: Come Soul, then follow me this day,
a Kingdom thou ſhalt gain, Mat. 16.24 Luk. 12.32. Iſa. 1.19.
If that thou do my Law obey,
the Father's Love obtain.
And liberty thou ſhalt in joy, Rev. 12.8, 9 Rev. 20.2. Rev. 14.3.
from ſin and Satan too;
Then my high Praiſes thou ſhalt ſing,
and taſte of Heavenly dew;
Where joyes there are for evermore, Iſa. 35.10.
ſighing ſhall fly away,
Rev. 21.4. Pſal. 65.1.Come of this joy now, taſte therefore,
and praiſes ſing alway.
Rev. 19.6. Iſa. 42.8. 2 Tim. 2.12.Yea, Hallelujah you ſhall ſing,
this Glorying none ſhall ſtain,
And you ſhall be ever with me,
and with me you ſhall reign.

div.head: CHRIST THE Afflicted Chriſtians RELIEF.

sp.speaker: Chriſt,
sp.l: COme thou afflicted Soul to me,
Pſal. 18.27. Pſ. 119.71. Num. 20.12and I will thee relieve;
I'le make afflictions ſweet to thee,
if in me thou believe.

sp.speaker: Afflicted,
sp.l: Dear Lord I come, make haſt to help,
on thee I do depend,
My God thou art, come cleanſe my heart,
and alſo me defend.

sp.speaker: Chriſt,
sp.l: Pſal. 34.15 Pſ. 119.67. Hoſ. 11.4. Rom. 5.5.Soul, I am nigh, to hear thy cry,
and ſanctifie I will
Thy affliction, and will make known,
my Love; come take thy fill.

sp.speaker: Afflicted,
sp.l: Oh! Pretious Lord, now grace affor •
to me I do thee pray,
And let thy Rod, now prove for good,
that I may thee obey.

sp.speaker: Chriſt,
sp.l: Afflicted Soul, hold up thy head, Luke 21.28. John 16.13. Pſal. 37.11.
my Grace it is at hand,
By my ſweet Spirit, thou ſhalt be led,
thou ſhalt injoy the Land.

sp.speaker: Afflicted,
sp.l: Sweet Lord, Oh! When wilt thou begin,
my wearied Soul to chear?
Come me revive, and make alive,
Oh Jeſus! now appear.

sp.speaker: Chriſt,
sp.l: I come dear heart, for to impart, Rev. 22.12. Lam. 3.24. Iſa. 53.3.
a Portion choice and ſweet,
Thy Soul i'le chear, Oh do not fear,
though troubles thou do meet.

sp.speaker: Afflicted,
sp.l: My Portion Lord, Oh! wilt thou be,
that on thee I might ſtay;
Come ſignifie, Lord unto me,
my God thou art this day.

sp.speaker: Chr.
sp.l: Afflicted Soul, I have made choice, Hoſ. 14.4. Iſa. 48.10. Deut. 8.16.
of thee to love indeed,
In the Furnace of Affliction,
for of it there is need.

sp.speaker: Afflict.
sp.l: True Lord, afflictions are needful,
by them teach me to mend
My life, that I reform'd may be,
yea now unto the end.

sp.speaker: Chr.
sp.l: My Spirit on thee will I beſtow, Joel 2.28. Mal. 3.2. Hoſ. 2.20. John 16.13.
that doth reform indeed,
Then to the end, thou ſhalt me know,
my Spirit ſhalt thee lead.

sp.speaker: Afflict.
sp.l: Dear Lord, Oh come, now give it out,
the Clouds gather a pace,
And put an end unto all doubt,
come help me run thy race.

lg.l: Afflicted Soul, I come, I come, Rev. 3.11.
the Clouds they ſhall diſpel, Cant. 2.17.
Reſolve I will thy doubts, Oh then! Rev. 21.3.
and with thee I will dwell.
Oh! welcome Lord, thou art to me,
let thee and I not part:
The more of thee that I now ſee,
is Joy unto my Heart.

sp.speaker: Chr.
sp.l: All Troubles hear, come do not fear,
Pſal. 34.6. Luk. 12.32. Pſa. 118.8.I'le put them to an end:
My reigning day is very near,
on me therefore depend.

sp.speaker: Afflicted.
sp.l: Dear pretious Lord, on Earth there's none
that truſt I can put in,
But only thee, and thee alone,
who art indeed my King.

sp.speaker: Chr.
sp.l: Soul do not fear, I will draw near,
Rev. 3.11. Rev. 19.7. Pſa. 115.1.my Kingdom for to take:
If thy truſt be alone in me,
of it thou ſhalt partake.

sp.speaker: Afflicted.
sp.l: It is my Burden Lord indeed,
and ſore Affliction too,
That more on thee I do not feed,
and witneſs thy ſweet dew.

sp.speaker: Chr.
sp.l: Come my Table is richly deck'd
Pſa. 36.8. Rev. 22.17. James 4.8.with Dainties of all kind,
And welcome thou may'ſt be to me,
and my ſweet Preſence find.

sp.speaker: Afflicted.
sp.l: Thy Preſence Lord is that I want,
I fain would it obtain:
Thy Dainties choice I reliſh not,
makes me for to complain.

sp.speaker: Chr.
sp.l: Come Soul and taſte a little then,
Pſal. 34.8. Pſal. 36.7. Pſal. 30.5.for ſweetneſs thou shalt find
In what I give, and thou shalt live,
and to thee I'le be kind.

sp.speaker: Afflicted.
sp.l: Lord to my Sorrow, my Soul loaths
thy Honey and thy Combe;
And with thy Food I cannot cloſe,
nor think thou wilt me own.

sp.speaker: Chr.
sp.l: A hungry and a thirſting frame,
Pſa. 42.1, 2. Cant. 5.1. Cant. 7.11.on thee I will beſtow:
My pleaſant Meat, thou then shalt eat,
and with me thou shalt go.

sp.speaker: Afflicted.
sp.l: Lord let me feel now Nouriſhment
in Bonds and Miſery:
Let me not ſink, but on thee think,
who art true Liberty.

sp.speaker: Chr.
sp.l: I will ariſe for thy relief, Pſa. 9.9. Iſa. 41.10.
and free thee in due Seaſon:
Uphold I will thy Soul now ſtill,
and bring thee out of Priſon. Pſal. 146.7.

sp.speaker: Afflicted.
sp.l: Darkneſs, dear Lord in me diſpel,
come manifeſt thy Power;
And in ſweet Canaan let me dwell
in this afflicting hour.

sp.speaker: Chr.
sp.l: My Light shall come, waite for me then,
and Canaan thou shalt ſee; Pſa. 97.11. Rev. 21.4. Rev. 21.25.
Then Affliction quite shall be gone,
thy night then day shall bee.

sp.speaker: Afflicted.
sp.l: Thou day Star, when wilt thou ariſe,
my Soul for to revive,
And with thy Wiſdom make me wiſe,
that I may daily thrive.

sp.speaker: Chr.
sp.l: Out of the Rod Sweetneſs shall come,
my Teaching choice alſo: Prov. 29.15 Pſal. 23.4. Mal. 4.2.
I will ariſe for thee my Son,
the Nations shall it know.

sp.speaker: Afflicted.
sp.l: Prepare O Lord thine Afflicted,
that ready we may be
Thee to attend, and us defend
From Satans Cruelty.

lg.l: I will you keep as my dear Sheep,
Satan shall not you harm; Iſa. 49.11. Pſal. 121.5. verſ. 7.
And you shall be preſerv'd by me,
in the moſt dreadfull ſtorm,
That on the Earth shall ſurely come,
before that I appear, Joel 3.16. Rev. 2.10. Iſa. 41.10.
To try all thoſe that I have choſe;
you have no cauſe to fear.

sp.speaker: Afflicted.
sp.l: Our trouble is, that thou ſeems ſtrange
unto thy Heritage,
And lets them be a daily Prey
to Beaſts that are ſavage.

lg.l: Iſa. 54.7, 8. Deut. 8.16. Iſa. 3.12. Iſa. 61.1.Though for a time I do ſeem ſtrange,
that humble they may be:
I will appear, their Souls to chear,
and bring ſweet Liberty.
Iſa. 54.11.The Afflicted and toſſed Ones
with tempeſt very high,
verſ. 12.Shall comfort find, I will be kind,
verſ. 13.and they ſhall magnifie
Luk. 1.46. verſ. 47. Pſa. 20.7.My great and glorious name indeed,
for in me they ſhall truſt;
And in Canaan they then ſhall be,
I am their God moſt juſt.
Iſa. 54.1. Zeph. 3.14. verſe 15. Rev. 3.21.Then the Afflicted ſhall rejoyce,
and never more complain,
But hearken will unto my voice;
then they with me shall reign.

div.head: A WORD to the REMNANT OF THE VVomans Seed.

lg.l:

rejoyce in thy dear King;

in oppoſition to

with Abſolon his crew.

lift up your heads oh then,

div.head: AN EXHORTATION to SAINTS, AS SAINTS, To Love one another.

lg.l: COme all you choſen of the Lord,
Pſ. 133.1. verſ. 2, 3.that on the Lamb attend,
Oh! learn to walk, with one accord,
unto Chriſt's Scepter bend.
Oh! let the Golden Rule of Love,
now ſquare our Actions here,
Gal. 6.16. Col. 3.2.Come learn the art to live above,
till Chriſt our King appear.
And in the lovely Path of Love,
Iſa. 30.21. Epheſ. 5.1.let us delight to walk;
Oh! imitate dear Chriſt our dove,
yea, of ſweet Canaan talk.
Jer. 9.24. Epheſ. 4.2. verſ. 3. & 13Love is indeed, God's great delight,
come walk in Love, Oh then!
And learn in truth for to unite,
it is a comely thing.
It doth adorn our profeſſion,
Gal. 5.13. John 14.16. 1 John 5.3.that of the Lamb we make,
And makes us free; yea, day by day,
his work to undertake.
1 Cor. 3.7.6. Gal. 5.22. Rom. 12.9. Col. 3.4.If love indure, it will procure,
great joy and peace alſo,
If it be pure, we ſhall be ſure,
to live with Chriſt the Roe.
Love is the thing that doth fulfil,1 Pet. 1.22. Rom. 13.18. Rom. 10.10. 1 Cor. 13.7.
the Royal Law of God,
And doth ingage the Soul now ſtill,
to bear the Fathers Rod.
Oh! love is that which doth adorn, John 13.34. 1 Cor. 13.7. Gal. 5.22.
a Chriſtian in his race,
And bears him up, now in the ſtorm;
it decketh him with Grace.
Love makes all yoaks eaſie to him,
that on the Lamb depend,1 Cor. 13.4. 1 Cor. 13.6.
And makes the Soul with joy to ſing,
to Chriſt who doth defend.
From clouds and ſtorms that doth ariſe,2 Cor. 4.8. Ja. 3.16, 17 John 10.3.
yea, troubles high and great,
Love is the thing, that makes us wiſe,
and proves Chriſt's waiting ſheep.
Come learn to walk, and live in love,
all Children of the King, Mat. 5.9. Tit. 3.9.
Vain jangling ſhun, and live above;
then we ſhall honour him.
And love where ever you do ſee, Col. 1.4. 1 Cor. 11.16 Epheſ. 1.4.
the Image of the Lord,
No more contentions let there be,
but walk with one accord.
Come in the grace of love abound,
alſo therein delight,1 Theſ. 3.13 2 Cor. 8.7. 2 Cor. 9.8.
For all things elſe that are not ſound,
now labour for to ſlight.
It is the want of love indeed,
that makes poor Zion groan, Heb. 13.1. 1 Cor. 13.3.
Unto the Law of Love take heed,
leaſt we make further moan.
For if afflictions will not make, Pſ. 119.67. Rev. 2.23. Rom. 13.10.
Gods Children to unite,
In peices he'l the Churches break,
becauſe his Law we ſlight.
If that in love we do not walk2 Cor. 13.11 Epheſ. 4.2.
and tender be alſo;
Our God he will not mind out talk,
1 Cor. 3.13.but will us overthrow.
2 Tim. 3.5. 1 John 3.8. Rev. 15.16.A bare profeſſion will not ſtand,
but fruits of love muſt be;
The Day of Chriſt it is at hand,
our love he'l try, you'l ſee,
By the touch-ſtone of his choice Word,
Rom. 12.9. 1 John 3.13.if love do not agree,
According to his ſweet record,
then own us will not he.
Eph. 5.1, 2. Iſa. 51.8, 9. verſ. 12.Come walk therefore, as children dear,
and now unite apace,
The Babylonions do not fear,
with joy let's run our race.
Rev. 14.1. Rev. 3.21.Then Hallelujah ſhall you ſing,
and reign with Chriſt indeed,
Upon the Throne of the High One,
in Canaan you ſhall feed.
All whiſperings and back-bitings,
2 Cor. 12.20 Prov. 16.26 Pſal. 37.4.abhorred let them be,
Let us delight in better things,
then plainly ſhall we ſee,
1 Col. 4. 1 Theſ. 3.22 1 Th. 4.9, 10Our Love appear, to all Saints here,
love to them will increaſe,
To ſuch that do dear Jeſus fear,
we ſhall them then imbrace.
2 Cor. 10.5. Jam. 3.13. Ga. 5, 14, 15Let no hard thoughts in us ariſe,
ſurmiſings at no rate,
Such things proves us, not to be wiſe,
but will our Union break.
Let's follow after all thoſe things,
Rom. 14.19 Prov. 6.16. verſ. 19.that tends to peace indeed,
All diſcords ſhun, from ſuch things turn,
of Love there is great need.
Ro. 12.9, 10 Pſal. 133.1. verſ. 2, 3.Learn to unite, in Bonds of Love,
like God's choſen of old,
It's well pleaſing, yea; a choice thing,
as God hath us fore-told.
Dear Jonathan, David the King,1 Sam. 18.1, 2, 3.
united were indeed,
In love moſt rare, it did appear,
as in Gods word we read.
A preſedent moſt choice and rare,1 Sa. 20.17. Heb. 13.1. Pſal. 121.2.
Oh! follow them herein;
Come love intire, of God deſire,
his help in this choice thing.
Then Saints as Saints, ſhall love ſincere; Col. 1.4. Phil. 1.10. 1 Jo. 5.7, 8.
they ſhall not diſagree,
But walk in Love, and much deſire
the union of the three.
Therefore unto God's Royal Law
of Love, let us take heed, Gal. 5.14. Col. 2.6. Rom. 12.9.
And it obey, yea day by day,
and walk in love indeed.
Like children dear, let Love appear, Eph. 5.1, 2. Pſal. 101.5. John 6.37.
in Love now be as one,
Slanders caſt out, then without doubt,
you ſhall injoy the Son.
His Righteous Beams, and Heavenly Streams, Pſal. 46.4. Pſal. 36.8. Luk. 12.32. Hoſ. 14.5.
ſhall alwayes you revive,
Though you are few, Chriſt's Heavenly dew,
will make you for to thrive.
Chear up oh then! depend on him, Pſal. 32.11. Pſal. 36.9. Pſ. 119.104 Iſa. 64.5.
who is the Fountain ſweet;
At his foot lie, all ſin defie,
your pretious Souls he'l meet.
In Holy Fear, to God draw near, Pſal. 5.7. Heb. 4.16. Pſa. 34.15. Pſa. 145.19
his Throne of Grace attend,
He'l hear thy cry, in faith draw nigh,
his Ear to thee he'l bend.
Who di'd for us that we might live, Rom. 5.6. Iſa. 26.19. Col. 3.3, 4.
and that eternally;
Come die to ſin, and live to him,
and we ſhall never die.
